text: Kyungon, United States National Geospatial-Intelligence Agency is a village in Wakema Township, Myaungmya District, in the Ayeyarwady Region of northcentral Myanmar. Kyungon is on the left (south) bank of the Pyamalaw River across from the village of Kwinbauk.Burma 1:250,000 topographic map, Series U542, NE46-16 Bassein, U.S. Army Map Service, September 1959 In 2009 a bridge over the Pyamalaw River at Kyungon was completed."Kyungon Bridge opened in Wakema Township" MRTV3 The bridge is a 500-foot suspension bridge, 14 feet wide, suitable for one-way traffic."Priority given to development of the roads after Roads Year was designated" The New Light of Myanmar 23 April 2006 ==Notes== ==External links== *"Kyungon Map — Satellite Images of Kyungon" Maplandia World Gazetteer Category:Populated places in Ayeyarwady Region
title: Kyungon, Wakema
